My Politics
I come originally from a ‘blue wall’ seat which was a safe Labour seat for years. Unlike Barnsley though, it changed to Conservative in 2019 but has now gone back to Labour, along with a boundary change to help it on its way. So, I have exposure to both Labour and Conservative policies and have voted for both in the past.
Not any more though! Like millions of voters, I identify with the key aims, objectives and policies of Reform UK, who I joined 18 months ago. Straightforward, common sense policies are what I prefer. The net zero policies currently being implemented by Labour are pushing up bills, damaging British industries like steel and farming, and making us less energy secure.
We can protect our environment with more tree planting, more recycling and less single use plastics. New technology will help, but we must not impoverish ourselves in pursuit of unaffordable, unachievable global CO2 targets. 1 Small Modular Reactor would be capable of powering the whole of South Yorkshire! I prefer that approach to taking farming land for solar panels and obliterating the landscape with wind farms built from turbines, all made in China.
